oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Multi-photon quantum interference with high visibility using multiport beam splitters
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Stobińska, M.
Laskowski, W.
Wieśniak, M.
Żukowski, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Multi-photon states can be produced in multiple parametric down conversion (PDC) processes. The nonlinear crystal in such a case is pumped with high power. In theory, the more populated these states are, the deeper is the conflict with local realistic description. However, the interference contrast in multi-photon PDC experiments can be quite low for high pumping. We show how the contrast can be improved. The idea employs currently accessible optical devices, the multiport beam splitters. They are capable of splitting the incoming light in one input mode to $M$ output modes. Our scheme works as a POVM filter. It may provide a feasible CHSH-Bell inequality test, and thus can be useful in e.g. schemes reducing communication complexity.
